xediaBgpMIB.name: xediaBgpMIB
xediaBgpMIB.description: This module defines additional objects for management of BGP in Xedia devices, above and beyond what is defined in the standard rfc1657, and proposed drafts.

xbgpAdminStatus.name: xbgpAdminStatus
xbgpAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of BGP in the router. It is the desired state of BGP. The value 'enabled(1)' indicates that the BGP process should be active in the router, while 'disabled(2)' indicates that BGP shold not be active in the router.

xbgpOperStatus.name: xbgpOperStatus
xbgpOperStatus.description: The current operational state of BGP on the router.

xbgpReflection.name: xbgpReflection
xbgpReflection.description: The administrative status of BGP route reflection. The value 'full(1)' indicates that BGP will perform full route reflection among client and non-client peers. A value of 'nonClientToClient(2)' indicates that routes will only be reflected between clients and non-clients, not among clients. A value of 'none(3)' indicates that no reflection will occur, regardless of the specific peer configuration.

xbgpClusterId.name: xbgpClusterId
xbgpClusterId.description: The route reflector cluster id used when there are multiple route reflectors in a cluster.

xbgpConfiguredMaxRoutes.name: xbgpConfiguredMaxRoutes
xbgpConfiguredMaxRoutes.description: The maximum number of routed Networks in the internal Route Table. It is the maximum total number of Dest/Mask (network) route entries. Depending upon system configuration and the number of route entries in the route table that are destination addresses with multple masks, it may not be possible to have a route table with the maximum number of routed networks. If this variable is changed, it will not take effect until the box is reset.

xbgpOperationalMaxRoutes.name: xbgpOperationalMaxRoutes
xbgpOperationalMaxRoutes.description: The maximum number of routed Networks in the internal Route Table. It is the maximum total number of Dest/Mask (network) route entries. Depending upon system configuration and the number of route entries in the route table that are destination addresses with multple masks, it may not be possible to have a route table with the maximum number of routed networks. If this variable is changed, it will not take effect until the box is reset.

xbgpConfiguredPeers.name: xbgpConfiguredPeers
xbgpConfiguredPeers.description: The number of peers currently configured.

xbgpEstablishedPeers.name: xbgpEstablishedPeers
xbgpEstablishedPeers.description: The number of peers currently configured and in the established state.

xBgpPeerTable.name: xBgpPeerTable
xBgpPeerTable.description: A list of BGP Peer entries.

xBgpPeerEntry.name: xBgpPeerEntry
xBgpPeerEntry.description: An entry containing additional management information applicable to a particular BGP Peer.

xbgpPeerRowStatus.name: xbgpPeerRowStatus
xbgpPeerRowStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the entry. Setting it to 'destroy' or 'notInService' removes the entry from the table. Setting it to either 'create', or 'active' will add a row to the table.

xbgpPeerReflectionClient.name: xbgpPeerReflectionClient
xbgpPeerReflectionClient.description: Enables a peer to receive IBGP routes reflected from this speaker.

xBgp4PathAttrTable.name: xBgp4PathAttrTable
xBgp4PathAttrTable.description: A list of BGP Peer entries.

xBgp4PathAttrEntry.name: xBgp4PathAttrEntry
xBgp4PathAttrEntry.description: An entry containing additional management information applicable to a particular BGP Path.

xbgp4PathAttrCommunity.name: xbgp4PathAttrCommunity
xbgp4PathAttrCommunity.description: The Community attribute specified for a path.

xbgp4PathAttrOrigId.name: xbgp4PathAttrOrigId
xbgp4PathAttrOrigId.description: The address of the originator of the route in the AS created by a route reflector.

xbgp4PathAttrClusterList.name: xbgp4PathAttrClusterList
xbgp4PathAttrClusterList.description: The cluster list for a reflected path.

xbgpCompliance.name: xbgpCompliance
xbgpCompliance.description: The compliance statement for all agents that support this MIB. A compliant agent implements all objects defined in this MIB.

xbgpAllGroup.name: xbgpAllGroup
xbgpAllGroup.description: The set of all accessible objects in this MIB.
